|wi1_if_name = |rad1mod = SparkLAN AP6256 |rad1modif = SDIO 3.0 |rad1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM43456; |rad1oui = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL |rad1txchains = 1 |rad1rxchains = 1 |rad1sstreams = 1 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n/ac |rad1ac = 433 |rad1n = 150 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 2.4 or 5 |rad1correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad1cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "PineBookPro_V2.1" and "2019-09-05" :are silkscreened on main board.
===Hardware specification=== *CPU: [[Rockchip]] RK3399 :Dual-Core ARM (Cortex-A72) @1.8GHz + :Quad-Core ARM (Cortex-A53) @1.4GHz *GPU: ''Mali-T864'' (OpenGL ES3.1, :OpenVG 1.1, OpenCL, DX11, AFBC) :VPU (w/ 4K VP9, 4K 10-bit H265/H264 decoding) *Storage: 16MB (NOR) Flash, 64GB (eMMC 5.1), :TF card (max.256GB)/MMC card slot *Memory: 4GB (LPDDR4) SDRAM *Wi-Fi: [[Broadcom]] BCM43456 :802.11abgn/ac (1T1R), BT 5.0 *USB: 1x USB 2.0, 1x USB 3.0, :1x USB 3.0 (Type-C) ports :(Data, Power and Video out) *Power Source: 5V 3A via barrel or :Li-Poly battery (3.8V, 10000mAh, 38Wh)
==Links of Interest== *[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pinebook ''Pinebook'' on '''Wikipedia'''] *[https://www.cnx-software.com/2019/07/25/buy-pinebook-pro-arm-linux-laptop/ ''PineBook Pro Arm Linux Laptop'' on '''CNX|Software'''] *[https://arstechnica.com/gadgets/2020/06/pinebook-pro-review-a-200-foss-to-the-hilt-magnesium-chassis-laptop/ ''Pinebook Pro'' Review on '''Ars Technica''']
==Pictures== <center>'''User Images''' <gallery mode="slideshow"> File:Pinebook Pro Top.jpeg|Board top File:Pinebook Pro Bottom.jpeg|Board bottom File:Pinebook Pro Daughter Top.jpeg|Daughter Board top File:Pinebook Pro Daughter Bottom.jpeg|Daughter Board bottom File:Pinebook Pro Internal.jpeg|Internal view </gallery></center>[[Has images::internal| ]]
